COMMAND.name: clear spanning-tree detected-protocols
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to clear spanning-tree detected protocols.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to clear spanning-tree detected protocols of all ports.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to clear spanning-tree detected protocols of all ports: Switch# clear spanning-tree detected-protocols

COMMAND.name: clear spanning-tree disabled-port
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to clear spanning-tree disabled ports.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to clear spanning-tree disabled ports, that is, set all port to enable.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to clear spanning-tree disabled ports: Switch# clear spanning-tree disabled-port

COMMAND.name: clear spanning-tree counters
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to clear spanning-tree BPDU counters.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to clear spanning-tree received and transmitted BPDU counters of specific port or all ports.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to clear spanning-tree BPDU counters all ports: Switch# clear spanning-tree counters

COMMAND.name: show spanning-tree
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to display spanning-tree configuration and infomation.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to display spanning-tree infomation, including global infomation and per-port infomation.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE:
This example shows how to display the spanning-tree information: Switch# show spanning-tree -----[Spanning-tree Enabled][Mode RSTP]----- Root Id - 8000-3c16.2830.c300 Bridge Id - 8000-3c16.2830.c300 Bridge Times - HelloTime 2, MaxAge 20, ForwardDelay 15, MaxHops 20 Root Info - Path Cost 0, Port 0, Bridge Priority 32768 Path Cost Standard - dot1t Tx Hold Count - 6 Port Default Action - BPDU-Filter Disabled, BPDU-Guard Disabled Last TopoChange Time - Thu Jun 2 05:12:33 2016
-----[Interface eth-0-1][Role Designated][State Learning]----- eth-0-1: Port - Index 1, Priority 128, Id 8001 eth-0-1: Port PathCost - admin None, oper 500 eth-0-1: Port Time - HelloTime 2, MaxAge 20, ForwardDelay 15, MessageAge 0 eth-0-1: Port Timer - Hello 1, ForwardDelay 1, MessageAge 0, TopoChange 0 eth-0-1: Designated - Root 32768-3c16.2830.c300, Bridge 32768-3c16.2830.c300 eth-0-1: Designated - Port Id 8001, Priority 128, Path Cost 0 eth-0-1: BPDU Count - Send 3, Received 0 eth-0-1: BPDU Version - RSTP, Send RSTP, Received None eth-0-1: Edgeport - admin Disabled, oper Off eth-0-1: BPDU Filter - admin Default, oper Off eth-0-1: BPDU Guard - admin Default, oper Off eth-0-1: Root Guard - admin Disabled, oper Off eth-0-1: Loop Guard - admin Disabled, oper Off eth-0-1: Link Type - admin Auto, oper P2p eth-0-1: Forward-transitions 0

COMMAND.name: show spanning-tree disabled-port
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to display spanning-tree disabled port.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to display spanning-tree disabled port.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to display the spanning-tree disabled port: Switch# show spanning-tree disabled-port Interface ---------------- eth-0-1

COMMAND.name: spanning-tree enable
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command enable spanning-tree.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The spanning-tree will initialize all protocol state-machine for all switch ports.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to enable spanning-tree: Switch(config)# spanning-tree enable

COMMAND.name: no spanning-tree enable
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command disable spanning-tree.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The spanning-tree will stop all protocol state-machine for all switch ports, and set all ports to forwarding state.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to disable spanning-tree: Switch(config)# no spanning-tree enable

COMMAND.name: spanning-tree mode
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command configure spanning-tree mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: System support stp and rstp mode.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure spanning-tree mode to stp: Switch(config)# spanning-tree mode stp

COMMAND.name: no spanning-tree mode
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command configure spanning-tree mode to default mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: None
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure spanning-tree mode to default mode: Switch(config)# no spanning-tree mode

COMMAND.name: spanning-tree pathcost-standard
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command configure spanning-tree pathcost standard.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: If the pathcost-standard is changed, cost of every port will be reset and auto-calculated.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure spanning-tree pathcost standard to dot1d-1998: Switch(config)# spanning-tree pathcost-standard dot1d-1998

COMMAND.name: no spanning-tree pathcost-standard
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command configure spanning-tree pathcost standard to default value.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: If the pathcost-standard is changed, cost of every port will be reset and auto-calculated.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure spanning-tree pathcost standard to default value: Switch(config)# no spanning-tree pathcost-standard

COMMAND.name: spanning-tree priority
COMMAND.help: Bridge priority for the common instance

PARAM.name: priority
PARAM.help: Bridge priority in increments of 4096, default value is 32768

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the bridge priority. Using a lower priority indicates a higher likelihood of the bridge becoming root.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to set the priority of the bridge. The priority values must be in multiples of 4096.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure spanning-tree bridge priority: Switch(config)# spanning-tree priority 4096

COMMAND.name: no spanning-tree priority
COMMAND.help: Bridge priority for the common instance
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the bridge priority to default value.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to set the priority of the bridge to default value.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure spanning-tree bridge priority to default value: Switch(config)# no spanning-tree priority

COMMAND.name: spanning-tree transmit-holdcount
COMMAND.help: Transmit hold count of the bridge

PARAM.name: count
PARAM.help: Transmit hold count, default value is 6

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure spanning-tree bridge transmit holdcount.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to configure spanning-tree bridge transmit holdcount.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure spanning-tree bridge transmit holdcount: Switch(config)# spanning-tree transmit-holdcount 3

COMMAND.name: no spanning-tree transmit-holdcount
COMMAND.help: Transmit hold count of the bridge
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure spanning-tree bridge transmit holdcount to default value.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to configure spanning-tree bridge transmit holdcount to default value.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure spanning-tree bridge transmit holdcount to default value: Switch(config)# no spanning-tree transmit-holdcount

COMMAND.name: spanning-tree tc-protection
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to enable spanning-tree bridge tc-protection.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: If tc-protection is set, the number of TC packets which can be processed every hello time interval shouldn’t be greater than the number of tc-protection threshold.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to enable spanning-tree bridge tc-protection: Switch(config)# spanning-tree tc-protection

COMMAND.name: no spanning-tree tc-protection
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to disable spanning-tree bridge tc-protection.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: If tc-protection is set, the number of TC packets which can be processed every hello time interval shouldn’t be greater than the number of tc-protection threshold.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to disable spanning-tree bridge tc-protection: Switch(config)# no spanning-tree tc-protection

COMMAND.name: spanning-tree forward-time
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure spanning-tree bridge forward time.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to configure spanning-tree bridge forward time. The bridge port will after the forward time and changes state to learning and forwarding.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure spanning-tree bridge forward time: Switch(config)# spanning-tree forward-time 10

COMMAND.name: no spanning-tree forward-time
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure spanning-tree bridge forward time to default value.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to configure spanning-tree bridge forward time to default value.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure spanning-tree bridge forward time to default value: Switch(config)# no spanning-tree forward-time

COMMAND.name: spanning-tree hello-time
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure spanning-tree bridge hello time.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to configure spanning-tree bridge hello time. The bridge port will send BPDUs in hello time interval.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure spanning-tree bridge hello time: Switch(config)# spanning-tree hello-time 4

COMMAND.name: no spanning-tree hello-time
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure spanning-tree bridge hello time to default value.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to configure spanning-tree bridge hello time to default value.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure spanning-tree bridge hello time to default value: Switch(config)# no spanning-tree hello-time

COMMAND.name: spanning-tree max-age

PARAM.name: timer
PARAM.help: Max age time, default value is 20

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure spanning-tree bridge max age.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to configure spanning-tree bridge max age. Max age is the maximum time for which (if a bridge is the root bridge) a message is considered valid. This prevents the frames from looping indefinitely. The value of maximum age should be greater than twice the value of hello time plus 1, and less than twice the value of forward delay minus 1.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure spanning-tree bridge max age: Switch(config)# spanning-tree max-age 30

COMMAND.name: no spanning-tree max-age
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure spanning-tree bridge max age to default value.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to configure spanning-tree bridge max age to default value.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure spanning-tree bridge max age to default value: Switch(config)# no spanning-tree max-age

COMMAND.name: spanning-tree edgeport

PARAM.name: bpdu-filter
PARAM.help: Filter the BPDUs on edgeport enabled ports

PARAM.name: bpdu-guard
PARAM.help: Guard the edgeport ports against bpdu receive

COMMAND.ACTION: if [ "bpdu-filter" == ${type} ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/l2/mstp_global/bpdufilter/1 else cdbctl update/cdb/l2/mstp_global/bpduguard/1 fi;
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to enable spanning-tree edgeport properties.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Enableing bpdu-filter ensures that edgeport enabled ports do not transmit or receive any BPDUs. Enableing bpdu-guard makes that edgeport enabled ports will enter port errdisable when receive any BPDUs.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to enable spanning-tree bridge edgeport bpdu-filter: Switch(config)# spanning-tree edgeport bpdu-filter

COMMAND.name: no spanning-tree edgeport

PARAM.name: bpdu-filter
PARAM.help: Filter the BPDUs on edgeport enabled ports

PARAM.name: bpdu-guard
PARAM.help: Guard the edgeport ports against bpdu receive

COMMAND.ACTION: if [ "bpdu-filter" == ${type} ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/l2/mstp_global/bpdufilter/0 else cdbctl update/cdb/l2/mstp_global/bpduguard/0 fi;
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to disable spanning-tree edgeport properties.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Enableing bpdu-filter ensures that edgeport enabled ports do not transmit or receive any BPDUs. Enableing bpdu-guard makes that edgeport enabled ports will enter port errdisable when receive any BPDUs.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to disable spanning-tree bridge edgeport bpdu-filter: Switch(config)# no spanning-tree edgeport bpdu-filter

COMMAND.name: spanning-tree link-type
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure port link-type.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to configure port link-type.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure port link-type: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# spanning-tree link-type point-to-point

COMMAND.name: no spanning-tree link-type
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure port link-type to default value.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to configure port link-type to default value.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure port link-type to default value: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no spanning-tree link-type

COMMAND.name: spanning-tree force-version
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure port force-version.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to configure port force-version.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure port force-version: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# spanning-tree force-version 0

COMMAND.name: no spanning-tree force-version
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure port force-version to default value.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to configure port force-version to default value.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure port force-version to default value: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no spanning-tree force-version

COMMAND.name: spanning-tree edgeport
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to enable port edgeport.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to enable port edgeport.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to enable port edgeport: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# spanning-tree edgeport

COMMAND.name: no spanning-tree edgeport
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to disable port edgeport.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to disable port edgeport.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to disable port edgeport: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no spanning-tree edgeport

COMMAND.name: spanning-tree edgeport bpdu-filter
COMMAND.help: Filter the BPDUs on edgeport enabled ports

PARAM.name: default
PARAM.help: Depends on global spanning-tree edgeport bpdu-filter configuration

PARAM.name: disable
PARAM.help: Disable BPDU filtering for this port

PARAM.name: enable
PARAM.help: Enable BPDU filtering for this port

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure port edgeport bpdu-filter properties.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: If select default, will uses bridge's edgeport bpdu-filter configurations.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to enable port edgeport bpdu-filter: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# spanning-tree edgeport bpdu-filter enable

COMMAND.name: no spanning-tree edgeport bpdu-filter
COMMAND.help: Filter the BPDUs on edgeport enabled ports
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure port edgeport bpdu-filter properties to default.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: If select default, will uses bridge's edgeport bpdu-filter configurations.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to enable port edgeport bpdu-filter to default: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no spanning-tree edgeport bpdu-filter

COMMAND.name: spanning-tree edgeport bpdu-guard
COMMAND.help: Guard the edgeport ports against bpdu receive

PARAM.name: default
PARAM.help: Depends on global spanning-tree edgeport bpdu-guard configuration

PARAM.name: disable
PARAM.help: Disable BPDU guarding for this port

PARAM.name: enable
PARAM.help: Enable BPDU guarding for this port

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure port edgeport bpdu-guard properties.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: If select default, will uses bridge's edgeport bpdu-guard configurations.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to enable port edgeport bpdu-guard Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# spanning-tree edgeport bpdu-guard enable

COMMAND.name: no spanning-tree edgeport bpdu-guard
COMMAND.help: Guard the edgeport ports against bpdu receive
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure port edgeport bpdu-guard properties to default.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: If select default, will uses bridge's edgeport bpdu-guard configurations.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to enable port edgeport bpdu-guard to default: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no spanning-tree edgeport bpdu-guard

COMMAND.name: spanning-tree guard
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to enable port guard properties.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The root guard makes sure that the port on which it is enabled is a designated port. This loop guard provides additional protection against Layer 2 forwarding loops.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to enable port root guard Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# spanning-tree guard root

COMMAND.name: no spanning-tree guard
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to disable port guard properties.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The root guard makes sure that the port on which it is enabled is a designated port. This loop guard provides additional protection against Layer 2 forwarding loops.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to disable port root guard Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no spanning-tree guard root

COMMAND.name: spanning-tree path-cost
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure port path-cost.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to configure port path-cost.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure port path-cost: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# spanning-tree path-cost 2000000

COMMAND.name: no spanning-tree path-cost
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure port path-cost to default value.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to configure port path-cost to default value.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure port path-cost to default value: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no spanning-tree path-cost

COMMAND.name: spanning-tree port
COMMAND.ACTION: if [ "enable" == ${action} ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/l2/mstp_port/${iface}/port_enable/1 else cdbctl update/cdb/l2/mstp_port/${iface}/port_enable/0 fi;
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure spanning-tree port enable.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to configure spanning-tree port enable.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure spanning-tree port enable: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# spanning-tree port enable

COMMAND.name: spanning-tree port-priority

PARAM.name: priority
PARAM.help: Port priority in increments of 16, default value is 128

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure port priority.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to configure port priority. The priority values must be in multiples of 16.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure port priority: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# spanning-tree port-priority 16

COMMAND.name: no spanning-tree port-priority
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure port priority to default value.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to configure port priority to default value.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure port priority to default value: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no spanning-tree port-priority

COMMAND.name: spanning-tree restricted-role
COMMAND.help: Restrict the role of the port
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to enable port restricted-role.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to enable port restricted-role.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to enable port restricted-role: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# spanning-tree restricted-role

COMMAND.name: no spanning-tree restricted-role
COMMAND.help: Restrict the role of the port
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to disable port restricted-role.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to disable port restricted-role.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to disable port restricted-role: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no spanning-tree restricted-role

COMMAND.name: spanning-tree restricted-tcn
COMMAND.help: Restrict propagation of topology change and received topology change notifications
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to enable port restricted-tcn.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to enable port restricted-tcn.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to enable port restricted-tcn: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# spanning-tree restricted-tcn

COMMAND.name: no spanning-tree restricted-tcn
COMMAND.help: Restrict propagation of topology change and received topology change notifications
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to disable port restricted-tcn.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to disable port restricted-tcn.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to disable port restricted-tcn: Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no spanning-tree restricted-tcn
